item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Warren Ellis
item.description: "You're miserable, edgy and tired. You're in the perfect mood for journalism." -- Warren Ellis

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description:
"Is there any point to which you would wish to draw my attention?'
'To the curious incident of the dog in the night-time.'
'The dog did nothing in the night-time.'
'That was the curious incident,' remarked Sherlock Holmes." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "You have a grand gift for silence, Watson. It makes you quite invaluable as a companion." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "When you have eliminated all which is impossible, then whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "There is nothing more deceptive than an obvious fact." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "As a rule, the more bizarre a thing is the less mysterious it proves to be. It is your commonplace, featureless crimes which are really puzzling, just as a commonplace face is the most difficult to identify." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
Kimberlee add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle [Sherlock Holmes] Doyle
item.description: "What one man can invent, another can discover." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle [Sherlock Holmes] Doyle

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "My dear Watson," said [Sherlock Holmes], "I cannot agree with those who rank modesty among the virtues. To the logician all things should be seen exactly as they are, and to underestimate one's self is as much a departure from truth as to exaggerate one's own powers." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "I am an omnivorous reader with a strangely retentive memory for trifles." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "It is a capital mistake to theorize before one has data. Insensibly one begins to twist facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts." -- Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Stephen Kendrick
item.description: "He wrote: "A religion to be true must include everything from the amoeba to the milky way." Nothing must be excluded from our view and purview for any faith to be true. " -- Stephen Kendrick

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Stephen Kendrick
item.description: "There is an old story from the Eastern tradition that says that when the gods created the universe, they found a place for everything but the truth, and this created a problem, because the gods did not want this wisdom discovered right away. One of the gods suggested the top of the highest mountain, another the farthest star, a third spoke up for the dark side of the moon, and another for the bottom of the deepest ocean. Finally, they decide to place truth inside the human heart. In that way, we would search for it all over the universe, with the secret within us all the time. " -- Stephen Kendrick

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "No good deed goes unpunished." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "With freedom, books, flowers, and the moon, who could not be happy?" -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The world is a stage and the play is badly cast." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The mystery of love is greater than the mystery of death." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "This wallpaper is dreadful, one of us will have to go." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I was working on the proof of one of my poems all the morning, and took out a comma. In the afternoon I put it back again." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes, death. Death must be so beautiful. To lie in the soft brown earth, with the grasses waving above one's head, and listen to silence. To have no yesterday, and no to-morrow. To forget time, to forget life, to be at peace. You can help me. You can open for me the portals of death's house, for love is always with you, and love is stronger than death is." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description: "Begin at the beginning," the King said, very gravely, "and go on till you come to the end: then stop." -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Monty Python
item.description: "No one expects the Spanish Inquisition! Our chief weapon is surprise, fear and surprise; two chief weapons, fear, surprise, and ruthless efficiency! Er, among our chief weapons are: fear, surprise, ruthless efficiency, and near fanatical devotion to the Pope! Um, I'll come in again..." -- Monty Python

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Grown-ups never understand anything by themselves, and it is tiresome for children to be always and forever explaining things to them" -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description:
"People where you live," the little prince said, "grow five thousand roses in one garden... yet they don't find what they're looking for...
They don't find it," I answered.
And yet what they're looking for could be found in a single rose, or a little water..."
Of course," I answered.
And the little prince added, "But eyes are blind. You have to look with the heart." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Kimberlee add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "It is such a mysterious place, the land of tears." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
